alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Northeast Highlands; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 08 at 11:15AM MDT until August 08 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, northeast, and west central New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands. In north central New Mexico, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Jemez Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. In northeast New Mexico, Far Northeast Highlands, Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass and Northeast Highlands. In west central New Mexico, Southwest Mountains. This especially concerns the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon, Cooks Peak, Luna, Black, Bear Trap and Cerro Pelado burn scars. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Life threatening flash flooding and debris flows are possible in and around recent wildfire burn scars. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Another round of slow moving showers and thunderstorms are expected this afternoon and evening over recent burn scars of northern and west central New Mexico. Rainfall amounts may exceed one inch in a short amount of time on these scars. Given recent rainfall and flooding in these areas, this rainfall could cause significant flash flooding impacts within and downstream of the burn scars. Heavy rain producing storms on the Sangre de Cristo Mountains will slowly shift onto lower elevations of northeast New Mexico as well. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Northeast Highlands; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains
